column4: Does even one of the video dvd burning applications on Ubuntu work?  I've tried all the ones I can find, k3b, brasero, devede, they're all horribly broken.
i used DeVeDe 48h ago to create a DVD. it worked fine.
I just spent an hour fighting with devede.  All it will do is telling me I don't have permission to write to the temporary directory.
(And a review of the code suggests it was written by someone extremely incompetent, so it's probably riddled with other critical bugs)
what is it using as a temporary directory?
(Surprise, if you _delete_ the temporary directory, you won't be able to write to it!)
I told it to use "/tmp/scratch", amongst various other settings.  I have write permission to it, honest.
i have never seen that behavior. and i have used DeVeDe more than once.
Well, that's quite fortunate for you, but it doesn't really help me.
Do you want to bring your laptop over to my house and burn this dvd for me?
if you have found bugs, report them and fix them in your local tree.
Seriously, the devede code is a trainwreck.  It's not worth fixing, it should be thrown away.
i don't need a DVD. you do. you drtive.
Along with the other useless, broken software that is, for some mysterious reason, packaged at all.
so throw it away and write something better. since that's the approach you seem to want to take.
Thanks for your recommendation.  Unfortunately devede is not going to work for me.
